documents.title: Welcome to Dokploy | Dokploy
documents.description: Dokploy is a open source alternative to Heroku, Vercel, and Netlify.
documents.summary: This document introduces Dokploy as an open-source, self-hostable deployment platform that simplifies application and database management using Docker and Traefik.

documents.title: Features | Dokploy
documents.description: Explore the comprehensive suite of features available in Dokploy for optimized application deployment and management.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive overview of Dokploy's features for managing application deployments, Docker Compose configurations, and database lifecycle operations.

documents.title: Reset Password & 2FA | Dokploy
documents.description: Reset your password to access your Dokploy account and disable 2FA.
documents.summary: This document provide instructions on how to reset a Dokploy account password and disable two-factor authentication using command-line tools within the Docker container.

documents.title: Architecture of Dokploy | Dokploy
documents.description: Overview of the core architecture components of Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document outlines the core architectural components of Dokploy, detailing how Next.js, PostgreSQL, Redis, and Traefik work together to manage deployments and traffic.

documents.title: Comparison | Dokploy
documents.description: A comparison of Dokploy, CapRover, Dokku, and Coolify
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive feature comparison between popular self-hosted deployment tools, including Dokploy, CapRover, Dokku, and Coolify.

documents.title: Installation | Dokploy
documents.description: Get Dokploy up and running on your server within minutes with this easy-to-follow installation guide.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for installing and configuring Dokploy on a virtual private server, covering system requirements, advanced installation options, and initial security setup.

documents.title: Uninstall | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to uninstall Dokploy on your server
documents.summary: This document provides a step-by-step guide to completely uninstalling Dokploy and its associated Docker services, volumes, networks, and local configuration files from a server.

documents.title: Goodies | Dokploy
documents.description: Dokploy has certain goodies that are external that can be used with Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document lists community-developed external tools and integrations for Dokploy, including deployment actions, infrastructure scripts, and software development kits.

documents.title: Manual Installation | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to manually install Dokploy on your server.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions and a comprehensive bash script for the manual installation and configuration of Dokploy on a Linux server. It covers system requirements, environment variable customization, and the deployment of core services using Docker Swarm.

documents.title: Troubleshooting | Dokploy
documents.description: Solve the most common problems that occur when using Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document provides troubleshooting solutions for common issues in Dokploy, covering domain connectivity, port configuration, volume mounting, and Traefik routing.

documents.title: Registry | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your registry settings to store your images and artifacts.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure Docker registry settings in Dokploy to securely store and manage images and artifacts across multiple applications. It details the specific fields required for authentication and the benefits of centralized credential management.

documents.title: Monitoring | Dokploy
documents.description: Monitor your applications and servers with Dokploy
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up and configure server and application monitoring in Dokploy Cloud, covering settings for refresh rates, data retention, and alert thresholds.

documents.title: Backups | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to create and restore backups of your Dokploy applications and services.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for creating, scheduling, and restoring full system backups for Dokploy applications using S3 destinations.

documents.title: SSH Keys | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your SSH keys to access your servers or clone Private Repositories.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and manage SSH keys in Dokploy for accessing private repositories and remote servers.

documents.title: Dokploy Cloud | Dokploy
documents.description: Deploy your apps to multiple servers remotely without worrying about the underlying infrastructure.
documents.summary: This document introduces Dokploy Cloud, a service that enables remote application deployment to various cloud providers and multiple servers to support scalability and high availability.

documents.title: Certificates | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your certificates to secure your applications.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage and configure SSL/TLS certificates within the Dokploy UI to secure applications and enable HTTPS via Traefik.

documents.title: Environment Variables | Dokploy
documents.description: Dokploy allows you to create and manage shared and service-level environment variables for your projects and environments.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage environment variables in Dokploy across project, environment, and service levels, including syntax for referencing shared values.

documents.title: Applications | Dokploy
documents.description: Explore the multiple deployment methods available in Dokploy, including GitHub, Git, Docker, and automated deployments via webhooks.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive overview of managing and deploying applications in Dokploy, detailing deployment methods, monitoring tools, domain configuration, and advanced container settings.

documents.title: Databases | Dokploy
documents.description: Discover how to create and backup databases easily with Dokploy, supporting a variety of database systems.
documents.summary: This document explains how to create, manage, and back up various database systems within the Dokploy platform, covering monitoring, environment variables, and advanced configuration options.

documents.title: Docker Compose | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use Docker Compose with Dokploy
documents.summary: This guide explains how to integrate and manage applications using Docker Compose and Docker Stack within Dokploy, covering configuration, environment variables, and deployment.

documents.title: Domains | Dokploy
documents.description: This section outlines how to configure domains for your applications in Dokploy, ensuring that your applications are accessible via custom URLs.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and manage custom or free domains for applications and Docker Compose services within the Dokploy platform. It covers DNS setup, HTTPS implementation via Traefik, and advanced routing techniques using path transformations.

documents.title: Videos | Dokploy
documents.description: Videos about how to install and use Dokploy.
documents.summary: A collection of video tutorials and external resources providing instructions on how to install, configure, and use Dokploy for application deployment and self-hosting.

documents.title: Watch Paths | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use watch paths in your application or docker compose.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and use watch paths to automate deployments by monitoring specific files or directories for changes in standalone applications or Docker Compose.

documents.title: Build Server | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to configure a custom build server to compile your applications separately from your deployment servers.
documents.summary: This guide explains how to set up and configure dedicated build servers in Dokploy to offload application compilation from deployment servers for better resource optimization.

documents.title: Schedule Jobs | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to automate tasks using Dokploy's Schedule Jobs feature
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and manage automated tasks in Dokploy using the Schedule Jobs feature, covering various job types including application, compose, and server-level scripts.

documents.title: Security | Dokploy
documents.description: Security features of Dokploy
documents.summary: This document outlines security best practices and recommended configurations for servers running Dokploy, covering firewall management, SSH hardening, and brute-force protection.

documents.title: Deploy Server | Dokploy
documents.description: Step-by-step guide to setup a remote server and deploy applications on a VPS.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive walkthrough for configuring remote servers and deploying applications via the Dokploy platform. It covers the complete workflow from SSH key management and server provisioning to final application deployment.

documents.title: EC2 Instructions | Dokploy
documents.description: Instructions for setting up a remote server on EC2
documents.summary: This guide provides step-by-step instructions for configuring an AWS EC2 instance and integrating it with Dokploy using SSH keys for remote application deployment.

documents.title: Webhook | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure webhook notifications for your applications.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and test webhook notifications in Dokploy to receive event data at HTTP endpoints in JSON format.

documents.title: GitHub | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure GitHub repositories for deployments. This includes setting up access tokens, repository names, and branches.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions on connecting GitHub accounts and organizations to Dokploy via a GitHub App to enable automated branch-based deployments.

documents.title: Auto Deploy | Dokploy
documents.description: Automatically deploying your application to Dokploy can be achieved through two primary methods using Webhooks or the Dokploy API. Each method supports various platforms and provides a streamlined deployment process.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up automated deployments in Dokploy using webhooks from various Git providers and DockerHub, or programmatically via the Dokploy API.

documents.title: Bitbucket | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your Bitbucket repositories for deployments. This includes setting up access tokens, repository names, and branches.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for connecting Bitbucket repositories to Dokploy and setting up automatic deployments using webhooks. It covers account authentication via app passwords and the configuration of environment-specific branches.

documents.title: Build Type | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn about the different build types available in Dokploy, including Nixpacks, Dockerfile, and Buildpack options.
documents.summary: This document explains the various build types supported by Dokploy for application deployment, covering Nixpacks, Railpack, Dockerfile configurations, Buildpacks, and static site hosting.

documents.title: Rollbacks | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to rollback your application in Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and use automatic Docker Swarm rollbacks and manual registry-based rollbacks within the Dokploy platform.

documents.title: Volume Backups | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to backup your volumes using Dokploy's Volume Backups feature
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure and manage volume backups in Dokploy for applications using Docker named volumes. It covers the setup of S3 backup destinations, safety considerations for data integrity, and the process for restoring backed-up volumes.

documents.title: Utilities | Dokploy
documents.description: Utilities for your Docker Compose application
documents.summary: This document explains Dokploy's isolated deployments utility for Docker Compose, which automates network isolation to prevent service naming conflicts while maintaining proper routing. It also details networking considerations for different installation types and potential issues with Docker Swarm network references.

documents.title: Example | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use Docker Compose with Dokploy
documents.summary: This tutorial explains how to deploy Docker Compose applications on Dokploy and manually configure domains using Traefik labels and external networks.

documents.title: Cloudflare | Dokploy
documents.description: This guide will cover how to configure a Cloudflare domain for your applications in dokploy or panel.
documents.summary: This guide provides instructions for configuring Cloudflare domains and SSL/TLS encryption modes for applications managed via Dokploy.

documents.title: Telegram | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure telegram notifications for your applications.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Telegram notifications in Dokploy to receive alerts about application events.

documents.title: Actions | Dokploy
documents.description: Manage S3 destinations.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage S3 destinations for database backups, including instructions for creating, editing, deleting, and testing storage connections.

documents.title: Okta | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure SSO with Okta (OIDC or SAML)
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for setting up Single Sign-On (SSO) using Okta via the OIDC or SAML protocols.

documents.title: Discord | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure discord notifications for your applications.

documents.title: Ntfy | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure ntfy notifications for your applications.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for configuring ntfy notifications within Dokploy to receive alerts for panel and application events.

documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Single Sign-On (SSO) using Keycloak and OpenID Connect within the Dokploy platform, including troubleshooting common integration issues.

documents.summary: This document provides a step-by-step guide on how to deploy a simple Vue.js application from a Git repository using Nixpacks. It covers configuration steps such as setting the build path, publish directory, and generating a domain.

documents.description: Learn how to use advanced features in your application.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for managing advanced application configurations in Dokploy, covering Docker Swarm orchestration, resource allocation, and remote build server integration. documents.description: Learn how to schedule and manage backups for your databases in Dokploy, with options for storage in S3 buckets.
